articles.content:
Here are five things you need to know about the coronavirus outbreak this Monday evening. We'll have another update on Tuesday morning.
1. Families to get compensation for NHS staff deaths

articles.author: By Jack Newman For Mailonline
articles.title: Somerset NHS Trust becomes first to prioritise black and ethnic minority staff for facemasks - Daily Mail
articles.description: Somerset Foundation Trust is treating its black, Asian and minority ethnic staff as 'vulnerable' to coronavirus after research showed they have been disproportionately affected by the virus,
articles.content:
A hospital trust is believed to be the first in the country to protect its ethnic staff by giving them priority for the fitting of masks.
Somerset Foundation Trust is treating all its black, Asian and minority ethnic staff as 'vulnerable and at risk' of coro… [+4030 chars]

articles.title: CORONAVIRUS LATEST: 10 more COVID-19 deaths in Northern Ireland - Derry Now
articles.description: The department of health has reported 10 more COVID-19 related deaths in Northern Ireland, bringing the total to 309, according to Public Health Agency (PHA) statistics. There have now been 3,374 confirmed positive cases. In the past day there have been 66 ne…
articles.content:

articles.author: Milo Boyd
articles.title: UK coronavirus death toll rises by 360 as number of people dying appears to be lowering - Mirror Online
articles.description: The death toll from the coronavirus in the UK has been updated on the day that Boris Johnson addressed the nation from outside Downing Street for the first time since he left intensive care
articles.content:
The number of people whose coronavirus deaths have been recorded in the UK in the past day appears to be the lowest since March.
Across England, Northern Ireland, Scotland and Wales, 360 people have died of Covid-19.
